favourite.article: Today facing the awful giant of "financial trouble", the devil whispered see Jesus don't know or cares for you. Well Satan, eat this, IN YOUR FACE!
This song touched my heart, I know Jesus cares especially through this time in my life. He cares.

This song really touches my heart and makes me cry. I ask myself does Jesus care when I am going through all these problems: health problems, financial problems. I want to be a good Christian but these problems push me behind. I just attended interviews this week for a position at a Bank. I pray God will answer my prayer because He cares.
This song has been my pillar of hope in all that I do. I thank God this far I have reached. It's because I know He cares.
This hymn always speaks to me. It is one of my favorites and it never gets old for me. It connects you with heaven and brings a sweet assurance that Jesus truly cares.
Beautiful song of inspiration.
Wonderful song, very uplifting and inspiring.
Thank you.

Thank God for people who were consecrated enough to allow God to inspire them to write these old hymns. How timeless they are! God brought this song to my heart this morning to lift my Spirit and to let me know He is aware of my situation and He is in charge. Glory be to Jesus for evermore!!! Let's be encouraged. God knows about whatever we're going through and He won't give us more than we can bear (1 Corinthians 10:11). Hang in there, He will make a way of escape for us.

I was inspired by this song to create a "HELP FROM ABOVE DEPARTMENT" in my Ministry which is fairly new a few months ago. Today, we, the FRESH ANOINTING AND MIRACLES CHRISTIAN CENTRE (FAM) INC., ASABA have started giving out support funds to men and women, youths that are skilled.
Love this song. Hello from Indonesia.
This song lifts me up in such a time like this...breaking point but hope is there that He still cares....Thank You Jesus.
The song crossed my mind cause I'm feeling down, lost and soo alone! Jesus cares.
I felt so lonely but after listening to this song my soul was lifted up because God cares, yes He does.

Oh Yes He cares and feels my pains. I first heard this song during The Joyous Celebration Concert held at ICC Durban, South Africa in July 2014. Very comforting and soothing to the weary heart. Worthy is The Lamb!
I just found myself in need of this song, and it means so much more for me today. Oh the comfort we find in God.
Amen ! Jesus cares. He is my Comfort in my pilgrim journey !
It became my song in the night sometime back when I was lost and needed affirmation that my Saviour cares, and oh yes He does care!!!!
This song makes me know that I belong somewhere. Even in times of sadness and loneliness I belong to Jesus who cares for me. AMEN!
I just thank Jesus for He's been there always for me! Thank you Jesus for caring about me though am not worthy.
It's been such an inspiring, spirit filling and uplifting song in such a situation when I really ask for forgiveness from my weary steps. Thanks dear Jesus for Your unending love and care.
Amen! For we have not a high priest which cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities... Heb. 4:15

This used to be my favorite song; and especially when i'm troubled I know that HE does care.... Does Jesus care when my way is dark With a nameless dread and fear? As the daylight fades Into deep night shades, Does He care enough to be near
I know that Jesus cares. Sometimes I need to say it out. I know He will see me through. It's only a matter of time.
Tremendous truth. Romans 5:8.

I am so glad He cares. O that the whole world could know! Our trails do not go unnoticed by Him and so many times we want Him to help us out quickly, when it is the trail that brings us to Him and changes us. He may not choose to deliver us, but it is guaranteed He will be with us every step of the way! HE DOES CARE!
It comforts me too, I was also crying when I listened to this song.

Does Jesus care when my way is dark With a nameless dread and fear? As the daylight fades Into deep night shades, Does He care enough to be near. Sure He does care when my way is dark. Hallelujah, praise the Lord.

This song is very spiritual, the lyrics get deeper into my heart. Each time I am burdened, this song draws me to the Cross. What magnificent talent from the composer. Though he passed on countless decades ago, today we still get blessed and strengthened by this song, quite opposite to the bubble gum music being composed today. To God be the Glory.
Sometimes when grief grips my heart, this songs changes my feelings. The assurance that His heart is touched gives me comfort.
I like so much this song.......
Yes, my JESUS cares.

Yes, our God is supreme and yes He and He alone understands and cares. This hymn also make me shed tears as it brings memories of my beloved mother whose tired body was taken home by our Heavenly Father. Thank Lord for such a remarkable and loving mother. She shall always be remembered by all those who were close to her. May her soul rest in eternal peace.
I always remember my beloved mother who died in the Lord. Anytime I listen to this song and reads the words I shed tears. May she rest in the bosom of the Lord!!! Amen.

This song helped me get saved. When God worked in the author's heart to write it, He was thinking of me. That is just too big to comprehend......what an AWESOME GOD we serve! He loves you more than you will ever know and He does care, just trust Him every bit and He will be there for you.
Thank You LORD for Your love.
This song reminds me of my father who was on the call of God.

Good is wonderful! He gave us this song barely 48hrs before my beloved wife was taken to glory. It was first a spiritual anaesthesia to cushion the severe chock, then it provided hope and direction to my wandering thoughts. How gracious God is that the very detail of my loss and the hope to keep afloat was provided before time. O yes He cares!

I'm in my darkest moment. Bills piling up , everyone who owes me isn't paying back, I get contract invest my money in them and I don't get paid. My marriage is a nightmare and the only hope and joy are my kids and I have just been occupying myself going to their swimming competitions and focusing on their studies but their perfomance has jus started going downhill. I have fasted and prayed many many times ive screamed and called out to God but seems all my even those that hate me now prevail over me. I doubt if I ever mean anything to God.

***Emmanuel Fatoyinbo******************* Be blessed my brother in the Lord. There are many believers in Jiddah. I lived there for three years. There are several Churches there and 7,000 who have not bowed the knee to Baal. You may be there with no Bible. There are Bibles in the churches; I know because I lived in Jiddah for three years. Pray that you may find them. Seek and you will find; knock and it shall be opened. In the Scriptures it is written: "In the world you will have tribulation; but be of good cheer because I have over come the world." Greet all the brethren for me. Tell them that I will never forget them until we sing together again in the Kingdom. Remind them to continue "Standing on the Promises of God." Tell all the Pastors and Deacons that I love them dearly.
JESUS ANSWERS PRAYERS. The only true God. Jehovah.

Oh yes He cares! Through the midst of trials, troubles, very deep despair and the feeling of terrible aloneness, I know my Savior cares! I am so thankful He cares for me, when my heart is still or when troubled, I know He cares.

I found my myself between the devil and the deep sea, with the cannibal around my side and no weapon to defend myself. I knew I was in a state call dilemma, but for His care and concern, I'd be history. Thank You Jesus.
Oh, I am so happy that He cares, because I was thinking if He sees me at all, but I am indeed grateful that He knows me.

I found this song at a time I was losing it. Hope was slipping away, faith was weak and I was despondent, lonely and weary! This song lifts my spirit...it's comforting to be reassured that Jesus cares at such a time!
Touched my heart with tears flowing my eyes as this song was my father's favourite, which played on his death on 16th Nov, 2010.

O yes He cares. It is so good to know this and to share it with others because many people feel so lonely and it's only when we reach out to them that we know they need to know that "o yes He cares" for real.

I became to learn this hymn when our pastor gave sermon last Sunday. Before one lady's husband who was faithful to the Lord in our church and had been sick for several years went to the Lord's presence she sang this hymn holding his hand. 'Our Savior is good shepherd.' He knows our hearts. He gives us eternal life. At the evening service we sang together thinking of him in the presence of the Lord.

I have always been inspired by this song. It really applies in all the seasons of our lives. Knowing that Jesus cares gives energy and courage to move forward. May God continue hearing and caring for all the dark chapters of our lives. Amen.
Jesus does not just care, He continues to invite us to trust Him with anything that's making us sad. Mat 11:28-30
I know Jesus cares no matter what I go through. Please be reminded that Jesus never stop caring for you. He loves us with an everlasting love.

Does Jesus care when my heart is pained? Oh yes He cares! What comforting words to know we have a loving and caring Jesus that will never leave us or forsake us. He promise He will be with us until the end. What a precious and caring Saviour. Oh I thank You precious Jesus for taking care of me.

Yes from time to time I need to be reminded that Jesus cares. I know You do Father and cannot wait to hold me in your arms when Jesus comes and there will be no more pain and sorrows. I know You know pain because You allowed Your Son to suffer for my sake so You must love me. I love You too.

Jesus cares a lot, when you dont ask for your needs because you don't know that you need them, He still provides. He is already gone to tomorrow so that when you get there, He would have already prepared a way for every circumstance. He prepares solutions for our future problems and then He gives us an expected end.
I sometimes feel that God is far away from me, but I know He always cares. And I know my Savior cares.
Whenever I am unhappy, God will always give me timely reminders of His teachings and His blessings. Whenever I count my blessings, I cannot but praise my Lord.
o yes He cares, i know He cares, His heart is touched with my grief.

Psalm 147:3-5 "He heals the brokenhearted. And binds up their wounds. He counts the number of the stars; He calls them all by their names. Great is our Lord, and mighty in power; His understanding is infinite."
Thank you dearest Lord, I know You care.
With the ups and downs in life and my walk with the Lord, may heart is often saddened and sore, and yet I know He always cares, and He feels with me.
